item.title: Final Fantasy: 6 Games With The Best Summon Systems, Ranked
item.description:
Summons are one of the most iconic things that appear in most Final Fantasy games including spinoffs. They were first introduced in Final Fantasy 3 in 1990 on the NES which is also the first game to introduce an interchangeable Job system for Final Fantasy . North America would not get to experience Final Fantasy 3 until the DS remake came out in 2006.

As for Summons, North American players would experience them in 1994 with Final Fantasy 6 which was coincidentally renamed Final Fantasy 3 on the SNES. Confusing names aside, again, Summons is a cool part of any game in this series. Some entries have integrated Summons into their gameplay mechanics better than others, so here are some top examples ranked appropriately.

6 Final Fantasy 12

Replace Party Members Temporarily With Espers

Final Fantasy 12’s Summons are called Espers and they are tied to the Zodiac signs. Zodiacs play a big part in the Ivalice games like Final Fantasy Tactics and Final Fantasy 12 . Through the story, players can unlock new Espers and in battle, characters can summon them to their side temporarily.

The other two party members will be replaced and only the summoner and the Esper will remain. For example, the main character Vaan can summon Belias, and the two can pal around together to fight monsters. Their time will be short, but if players use their summoned creature effectively, then they can get through any tough situation.

5 Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth

Power Up Summons Through Tomb Raiding

Final Fantasy 7 introduced Materia to the series. These crystallized orbs contained passive abilities like HP+, spells like Fire, and even summonable creatures called Summons like Ifrit. In the first remake, most Summons could be rewarded through VR-simulated battles.

In the follow-up, Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth , players could find relics of Summons in the lands they traveled to. One of the NPCs, Chadley, would then convert discovered data into VR battles so that players could get a piece of Materia after they were victorious in battle. For example, the Summon of the Cosmo Canyon region was Bahamut Arisen. Once summoned in battle, these creatures would fight alongside the whole party and they could be issued commands along with following a basic AI set of abilities.

4 Final Fantasy 6

Learning Spells From Gods

Final Fantasy 6 had a prototype version of Materia from Final Fantasy 7 , but many could argue it was actually better. Like Final Fantasy 12 , Final Fantasy 6’s Summons were called Espers. When a new one was acquired, a character could equip it and then use it in battle for a random effect.

Shiva, for example, would attack all enemies with ice as she always does in these games. Besides their use in battle, characters could learn magic from Espers. Once learned, characters would know these spells forever which was a unique way of using Summons up to this point.

3 Final Fantasy 8

Draw Magic And Boost Stats

This game has a completely unique name for their Summons which had never been replicated. Guardian Forces, or GFs, were obtained through Final Fantasy 8’s story and optional boss battles. The first one players could acquire was Ifrit. Once obtained, players could link that GF to a character and then equip unlocked commands to that character.

For example, the universal command each GF dished out was called Draw. Characters could absorb magic through this command from monsters to use in battle or they could equip spells to stats linked to their GFs like Strength. It was a wild system at the time and it is still odd now, but that doesn’t mean it was bad. Quite the contrary, as the GFs were an interesting way to handle equipment, magic, and Summons all tied to one system.

2 Final Fantasy 10

The First Big Upgrade To Summons In Ten Games

Final Fantasy 10 was a big upgrade for the series in many ways from the graphical upgrade on the PS2 from the PS1 to the voice acting. Summons got a big boost too, called Aeons, as they were directly tied to Final Fantasy 10’s story which was not new but it was still a different approach. Yuna was a Summoner who had to go on a pilgrimage to get as many Aeons as possible to battle a world-destroying creature named Sin.

While characters could share skills via the leveling-up system called the Sphere Grid, only Yuna could summon Aeons. When she did, the rest of the party would be replaced and players could then only issue commands for this Aeon until they called it back or it died. Even after an Aeon died, Yuna could summon another one onto the battlefield from classics like Bahamut to oddities like Yojimbo. It is kind of like the Esper system from Final Fantasy 12, but Yuna’s close bond with these Aeons makes it stick out more as if she were a Pokemon Trainer.

1 Final Fantasy 16

Square Enix Borrows Heavily From Naruto To Give You Direct Control Of Eikons

Final Fantasy 16 was a divisive entry but one thing no one can argue with is how it elevated Summons for the series. In the game, nations had champions called Dominants who carried the souls of Summons within their bodies called Eikons. The main character, Clive, was the Dominant for the Eikon Ifrit, for example. Clive could also absorb the powers from other Dominants to gain their powers from linked weapons to spells thus opening up a variety of skill trees.

This was a cool system for leveling up but the main draw of Final Fantasy 16 was the Eikon boss encounters which played out like giant Kaiju battles. This put players in the role of Ifrit to tear through other gigantic Eikons. There were some other surprises too but that would require more spoilers. It’s hard to tell if Summons will or could ever get this epic again from a gameplay angle.

item.title: Planet Coaster 2: Release Time & Date
item.description:
Quick Links

  • When Is The Planet Coaster 2 Release Date?
  • Planet Coaster 2 Launch Time & Global Release Times

The highly anticipated follow-up to one of the best Theme Park simulator games of all time is right around the corner. Frontier Developments' Planet Coaster 2 is just about to launch at a time with few games that can stand up to the customizability and mechanics of the original Planet Coaster , and it won't be long until you can get your hands on it.

But depending on where you live, you may have to wait "longer" to start customizing your park in Planet Coaster 2, as the launch day for Planet Coaster 2 in your region may differ from others. Though the game comes out at the same time globally, this guide explains exactly when you can expect Planet Coaster 2 to release in your time zone.

When Is The Planet Coaster 2 Release Date?

Depending on your Time Zone, you can start playing Planet Coaster 2 on either November 6 or November 7. Though the game is listed as releasing on November 6, if you live significantly ahead of U.S. time, it could end up being the 7th instead.

This is because the Planet Coaster 2 release date has a concurrent launch on all platforms – PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S.

Planet Coaster 2 Launch Time & Global Release Times

According to the PlayStation store listing for the game, Planet Coaster 2 launches at 7 a.m. U.S. (PDT) and 10 a.m. U.S. (EDT) on November 6, 2024.

Because it releases at the same time worldwide on all platforms, if you convert either of these two U.S. based timezones to your own timezone, you will find Planet Coaster 2 release time for your country or location.

For convenience, the table below lists some of the most common global time zones, to help players figure out when Planet Coaster 2 comes out for their own timezone.

Country/Timezone

Planet Coaster 2 Release Time

Release Date

U.S. (PST)

7 a.m.

Nov 6

U.S. (MST)

8 a.m.

Nov 6

U.S. (EDT)

Nov 6

11 a.m.

Nov 6

Nov 6

Poland

Nov 6

Australia (West)

Nov 6

Nov 7

Australia (East)

1 a.m.

Nov 7

New Zealand

3 a.m.

Nov 7

item.title: Hogwarts Legacy: Best Ron Weasley Build
item.description:
There may be many years between Hogwarts Legacy and the start of the Harry Potter story, but there are plenty of ways for players to make connections between those two eras. This includes trying to recreate some iconic characters from the beloved books and movies. Ron Weasley is one such character that fans are surely looking to mold their character after. While players can meet one of Ron's distant relatives in the form of one of the school's professors in the game, they can also bring the red-headed firecracker to life, albeit not exactly perfectly.

Players can get the look of their character rather close, and can certainly get his House and spell style correct. It really isn't that complicated either, as fans already know so much about the character: he's a fiercely loyal friend ( Goblet of Fire excluded) and, despite his occasional mistakes , always does his best to do right by his friends and family. He's known for his bright red hair, his freckles, and his messy, but powerful enough, abilities with magic. To bring this character to the popular game, players only need to follow this guide right here.

Best Ron Weasley Build

The first part of creating Ron Weasley in Hogwarts Legacy is to nail down the iconic look of the character . This can be done with the following values in the character creation section at the beginning of the game:

  • Face shape: 7th option
  • Skin Color: 1st option
  • Glasses: None
  • Hair Color: Orange/Red (18th option)
  • Hairstyle: 15th option
  • Complexion: 3rd option
  • Freckles and Moles: 2nd option
  • Scars and Markings: 1st option
  • Eye Color: 10th option
  • Eyebrow Color: 18th option
  • Eyebrow Shape: 4th option
  • Tone: Voice 1
  • Pitch: Highest option

Finally, choose the Wizard dormitory to round out the entire character creation.When it comes time to choose the House for the character, players obviously need to select Gryffindor , where all the Weasleys have been, including Ron.

In terms of actually roleplaying, Ron wasn't ever known for his effectiveness with spells like Expelliarmus or Accio. He was always more of a loose cannon, so players should stick with the more bombastic spells like Bombarda, Incendio, and Confringo .

Also, the only Unforgivable Curse that Ron would use is the Imperius Curse on occasion. He would never use Crucio or Avada Kedavra; that's not what a Gryffindor does.

item.title: Horizon Zero Dawn Remastered: How To Get Rat Bone and Rat Skin
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Acquire Rat Bone and Rat Skin in Horizon Zero Dawn Remastered
  • Why You Need Rat Bone and Rat Skin in Horizon Zero Dawn Remastered

Horizon Zero Dawn is a thrilling adventure from start to finish — most of the time, that is. Like many open-world games, there are downtimes. In this game, some of those downtimes come from hunting, which is necessary for upgrading your gear.

Unfortunately, not all hunting is engaging or enjoyable. For instance, hunting rats can be more annoying than fun, yet you still need to do it to enhance your character's arsenal. The guide below provides details on where to find several Rats and how to farm them for the resources you need, so you won’t have to search for them ever again.

How To Acquire Rat Bone and Rat Skin in Horizon Zero Dawn Remastered

Rats are surprisingly tricky to hunt in Horizon Zero Dawn — not because they’re tough, but because they’re so small and quick that tracking them down can be a hassle. Hunting them feels like a game of Tom and Jerry, and their spawn points are also less common than those of other animals like Boars and Foxes.

For consistent rat farming, head to a familiar spot: the Ruins just to the right of Mother's Watch . This is the same location Aloy explored as a child at the start of the game. Once you reach the bottom of the Ruins, draw your bow and get ready — plenty of rats will spawn here, so keep hunting until you’ve gathered all the Rat Bones and Skins you need.

Why You Need Rat Bone and Rat Skin in Horizon Zero Dawn Remastered

Like other animal resources, Rat Bone is an uncommon item, while Rat Skin is rare , so you may need to farm a few extra rats to collect enough skins. Fortunately, you won’t need many to craft everything. In total, you’ll need 4 Rat Bones and 3 Rat Skins (4 Skins if playing NG+ or 5 if playing NG+ on Ultra Hard).

Here’s a list of items that require Rat Bone and Rat Skin:

1 Rat Bone Required for Each Item:

  • Blast Sling Ammo Pouch Upgrade 3
  • Rattler Ammo Pouch Upgrade 2
  • Sling Ammo Pouch Upgrade 3
  • Stormslinger Ammo Pouch Upgrade 3

1 Rat Skin Required for Each Item:

  • Blast Sling Ammo Pouch Upgrade 4
  • Rattler Ammo Pouch Upgrade 3
  • Stormslinger Ammo Pouch Upgrade 4

You’ll also need 1 Rat Skin to acquire the Adept Rattler weapon in NG+ and 2 if playing on Ultra Hard difficulty.

item.title: Pokemon GO - All Ditto Disguises (November 2024)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Pokemon GO: Every Ditto Disguise In November 2024
  • Pokemon GO: How To Increase The Odds Of Catching Ditto

Pokemon GO offers you a chance to encounter both Ditto and Shiny Ditto in the wild in November 2024. Ditto can copy the appearances and prowess of any monster it imitates. But you should know there are no changes to Ditto disguises for this month .

You might find it hard to spot a wild Ditto, but the developers at Niantic have provided ways to pinpoint it in Pokemon GO . There are only a few monsters that Ditto can copy, but the potential disguises change occasionally. You must first figure out which monsters Ditto can disguise and look for them in the wild; there is a chance that one of them will be Ditto or Shiny Ditto. That said, this guide details all the Ditto disguises for November 2024.

Pokemon GO: Every Ditto Disguise In November 2024

Niantic changes the Ditto disguises now and then. Currently, there are multiple monsters Ditto can copy for November 2024. Although there is no guarantee, lucky Pokemon GO trainers may also encounter a Shiny Ditto. You have to encounter numerous Ditto to catch up with its Shiny odds . Here are all the possible picks.

All Ditto Disguises

Oddish

Koffing

Rhyhorn

Goldeen

Numel

Bidoof

Gothita

Solosis

Bergmite

Stufful

Spinarak

One should be on the lookout for these spawns. If players get an "Oh?" prompt after catching it, the monster is a Ditto in disguise .

Pokemon GO: How To Increase The Odds Of Catching Ditto

While catching a Ditto is already a 1 in 50 chance, players can increase their odds by encountering as many pocket monsters as possible. The best way to do this is to use Pokemon GO Lure Modules or an Incense in a PokeStop or Gym. These items increase the number of Pokemon that appear on the world map, meaning more encounters and chances to find a Ditto.

One can also use the in-game item Incense and the Weather Boost function. Since its spawn rate gets boosted in partly cloudy weather, attach a Lure Module to a Pokemon GO PokeStop or Gym with such weather condition, activate an Incense, and walk around that area.

It's also worth utilizing the Daily Adventure Incense, an item granted once daily that is active for 15 minutes and attracts Pokemon that aren't normally found in the wild. As long as the Pokemon GO player keeps moving, Pokemon will continue to spawn for 15 minutes, occasionally leading to some rare catches.
